Base:Descriptions.Base:Description: the Colosseum

Spread out before you is an impressive colosseum arena complete with a centrally-located pit for bouts. Individual banners bearing the symbols of each of various nations are strung up on decorated black poles. Two sets of tri-tier platforms bearing a multitude of granite benches have been constructed and situated just to the north and south to provide ample seating for attendees. A special luxury box decorated with carvings comprises most of the third tier of the southern platform, reserved for those of noble birth or high rank.

Spread out before you is an impressive colosseum arena complete with a centrally-located pit for bouts. Individual banners bearing the symbols of each of various nations are strung up on decorated black poles. Two sets of tri-tier platforms bearing a multitude of granite benches have been constructed and situated just to the north and south to provide ample seating for attendees. a pair of iron gates leading west

A pair of large iron gates bearing a seamless filigree pattern along the top. At the center of the gates, also wrought in iron, is the image of a kite shield. Vertical bars spaced approximately hand-width apart extend the length of both gates. $(parent-desc)
the dueling arena

An arena for dueling. It is a square pit constructed on an elevation filled with fine, sieved, and moistened earth for the combatants. It is surrounded by four poles adorned with the banners of various nations.
An arena for dueling. It is a square pit constructed on an elevation. It is surrounded by four poles adorned with banners.
wine-colored canvas awning
A wine-colored canvas awning adorned with a wreath of oak and olive branches which envelops the top of the luxury box. It is designed to protect those within from the elements.
the banners
Four banners, one at each corner of the arena pit, hang high above on steel poles, representing various nations of the continent.
granite bench
A chiseled granite bench without back or arms, completely stiff and uncomfortable. It stands on the first northern tier.
A long, chiseled granite bench without back or arms. It stands on the first northern tier.
granite bench
A chiseled granite bench without back or arms, completely stiff and uncomfortable. It stands on the first northern tier.
A long, chiseled granite bench without a back or arms. It stands on the first northern tier.

A chiseled granite bench without back or arms, completely stiff and uncomfortable. It stands on the second northern tier.

granite bench
A chiseled granite bench without back or arms, completely stiff and uncomfortable. It stands on the third northern tier.

granite bench
A chiseled granite bench without back or arms, completely stiff and uncomfortable. It stands on the first southern tier.

granite bench
A chiseled granite bench without back or arms, completely stiff and uncomfortable. It stands on the second southern tier.
A long, chiseled granite bench without a back or arms. It stands on the second southern tier.
granite bench
A chiseled granite bench without back or arms, completely stiff and uncomfortable. It stands on the second southern tier.

the benches
The long, uncomfortable granite benches lining the tiers on either side of the arena.
The granite benches lining the tiers on either side of the arena.
the luxury box

An elaborately carved, raised limestone box is situated on the third tier at the south side of the arena. A row of six high-backed goldwood chairs, split by a matching goldwood table, provides a complete and comfortable view of the area below. A wine-colored canvas awning envelops the top, protecting those within from the elements. $[::show_box_contents()]

An elaborately carved limestone box is situated as the third tier at the south side of the arena. Its raised design provides high-ranking attendees a complete view of the battles below. $[::show_box_contents()]
modest building
The west side of a modest building constructed from limestone. It bears a polished beech door, above which is carved this phrase: PVGNEMVS VT VINCAMVS. This translates as: LET US FIGHT TO WIN.
The west side of a modest building is constructed from carved limestone. A door leads inside.
the carvings on the luxury box

Elaborate frieze-style carvings depicting a naval battle scene decorate the entire outside portion of the luxury box. The scene begins on the east side with numerous ships, each one overlapping the next, seeming to go on for miles on the two-dimensional surface. Following around to the north face of the box, the front line of the fleet can be seen opposite a shore riddled with foot soldiers, separated by a latticework gate. A man dressed in decorative clothing with a high-crested helmet stands at the prow of the foremost ship with sword extended. Canon balls and like ammunition careen past him on all sides, both toward and from the infantrymen on land. Finally, as your eyes follow around to the west panel, you see several more foot soldiers pushing rolling cannons toward the front in order to assist their comrades against the fleet.
Elaborate carvings depicting a naval battle scene decorate the entire outside portion of the luxury box.
the center of the dueling pit
The center of the dueling pit, and also of the room. It's where combatants meet and address formalities before engaging in combat.
The center of the dueling pit, and also of the room. It's where combatants meet and address formalities before engaging in combat.
goldwood chair
One of the high-backed goldwood chairs padded with stuffed grey velvet and lined up toward the front of the luxury box.
goldwood chair
One of the high-backed goldwood chairs padded with stuffed grey velvet and lined up toward the front of the luxury box.

goldwood chair
One of the high-backed goldwood chairs padded with stuffed grey velvet and lined up toward the front of the luxury box.
the northeast corner of the pit
The northeast corner of the pit. A French and an Italian banner hangs from a solid black pole here.
The northeast corner of the pit. A French and an Italian banner hangs from a solid black pole here.
the northwest corner of the pit
The northwest corner of the pit. A German and an English banner hangs from a solid black pole here.
The northwest corner of the pit. A German and an English banner hangs from a solid black pole here.
the southeast corner of the pit
The southeast corner of the pit. A Scottish banner hangs from a solid black pole here.
The southeast corner of the pit. A Scottish banner hangs from a solid black pole here.
the southwest corner of the pit
The southwest corner of the pit. A Spanish banner hangs from a solid black pole here.
The southwest corner of the pit. A Spanish banner hangs from a solid black pole here.
the corners of the pit
The corners of the pit.
The corners of the pit.
the ground
The ground around the arena is covered with a densely packed layer of sand. Although raked even, the frequent traffic over the area leaves a myriad of footprints in the sand.
the luxury box gate
A polished beech latticework gate restricting access to the luxury box.
the pit
A pit for dueling. It is square and constructed on an elevation filled with fine, sieved sand for the combatants. It is surrounded by four poles adorned with the banners of various nations.
A pit for dueling. It is square and constructed on an elevation. It is surrounded by four poles adorned with banners.
northeast pole

A ten-foot-high black steel pole is located at the northeast corner of the pit. Trails of wisteria delicately decorate its body, winding upward to present the Italian and French banners hanging from here.
A solid black steel pole standing about ten feet in height and located at the northeast corner of the pit. An Italian and French banner hangs from here.
northwest pole

A ten-foot-high black marble pole is located at the northwest corner of the pit. Trails of edelweiss lushly cling to its body, winding upward to present the German and English banners hanging from here.
A solid black marble pole standing about ten feet in height and located at the northwest corner of the pit. A German and an English banner hangs from here.
southeast pole

A ten-foot-high polished wumu pole is located at the southeast corner of the pit. Trails of wild marsh violets and cherry blossoms densely decorate its body, winding upward to present the Scottish banner hanging from here.
A highly-polished wumu pole standing about ten feet in height and located at the southeast corner of the pit. A Scottish banner hangs from here.
southwest pole

A ten-foot-high varnished black emberwood pole is located at the southwest corner of the pit. The bottom half is engulfed in various hues of purple geraniums while the upper portion flares upward in gilded brilliance to present the Spanish banner hanging from here.
A varnished black emberwood pole standing about ten feet in height and located at the southwest corner of the pit. A Spanish banner hangs from here.
the poles
Four solid back steel poles, one at each corner of the arena pit. Each bears a single banner for one of a nation of the continent.
the northern staircase
A smooth granite staircase is situated on the north side of the arena. Set into the center of the tiers, the staircase gives easy access to the upper tiers.
the southern staircase
A smooth granite staircase is situated on the south side of the arena. Set into the center of the tiers, the staircase gives easy access to the upper tiers, as well as the luxury box.
carved goldwood table
A small goldwood table with carvings along the legs that resemble foliage. The table stands at the center of the luxury box, dividing the line of chairs.
the first northern tier

A smooth granite tier is situated at the north side of the arena. This is the lowest level of seating and provides the closest view. Two long granite benches decorate the left and right of this platform.
the second northern tier

A smooth granite tier is situated on the north side of the arena. This area provides mediocre seating, offering a somewhat distant view of the pit. Two long granite benches decorate the left and right of this platform.
the third northern tier

A smooth granite tier is situated at the north side of the arena. This area provides a distant, unclear view of the pit and is quite probably the worst seating available. Two long granite benches decorate the left and right of this platform.
the first southern tier

A smooth granite tier is situated on the south side of the arena. This is the lowest level of seating and provides the closest view. Two long granite benches decorate the left and right of this platform.
the second southern tier

A smooth granite tier is situated on the south side of the arena. This area provides mediocre seating, offering a somewhat distant view of the pit. Two long granite benches decorate the left and right of this platform.
the granite tiers

Three graduated granite tiers flank either side of the arena to the north and south, allowing even those far in back to see with relative ease. A raised luxury box sits high atop the third southern tier.
